SEARCH
Package org.opengrok.indexer.authorization

Class AuthorizationPlugin

java.lang.Object
org.opengrok.indexer.authorization.AuthorizationEntity
org.opengrok.indexer.authorization.AuthorizationStack
org.opengrok.indexer.authorization.AuthorizationPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Nameable
public class AuthorizationPlugin extends AuthorizationStack
This is a subclass of AuthorizationEntity and is a wrapper to a IAuthorizationPlugin delegating the decision methods to the contained plugin.
Author:
Krystof Tulinger
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • load

      public void load(Map<String,Object> parameters)
      Call the load method on the underlying plugin if the plugin exists. Note that the load method can throw any throwable from its body and it should not stop the application.

      If the method is unable to load the plugin because of any reason (mostly the class is not found, not instantiable or the load method throws an exception) then any authorization check should fail for this plugin in the future.

      Overrides:
      load in class AuthorizationStack
      Parameters:
      parameters - parameters given in the configuration
      See Also:
      • IAuthorizationPlugin.load(java.util.Map)

    • unload

      public void unload()
      Call the unload method on the underlying plugin if the plugin exists. Note that the unload method can throw any throwable from its body and it should not stop the application.
      Overrides:
      unload in class AuthorizationStack
      See Also:
      • IAuthorizationPlugin.unload()

    • isAllowed

      public boolean isAllowed(Nameable entity, AuthorizationEntity.PluginDecisionPredicate pluginPredicate, AuthorizationEntity.PluginSkippingPredicate skippingPredicate)
      Test the underlying plugin with the predicate if and only if the plugin is not marked as failed.
      Overrides:
      isAllowed in class AuthorizationStack
      Parameters:
      entity - the given entity - this is either group or project and is passed just for the logging purposes.
      pluginPredicate - predicate returning true or false for the given entity which determines if the authorization for such entity is successful or failed for particular request and plugin
      skippingPredicate - predicate returning true if this authorization entity should be omitted from the authorization process
      Returns:
      true if the plugin is not failed and the project is allowed; false otherwise
      See Also:
      • AuthorizationEntity.isFailed()
      • IAuthorizationPlugin.isAllowed(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, Project)
      • IAuthorizationPlugin.isAllowed(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, Group)

    • setPlugin

      public boolean setPlugin(IAuthorizationPlugin plugin)
      Set the plugin to this entity if this entity requires this plugin class in the configuration. This creates a new instance of the plugin for each class which needs it.
      Overrides:
      setPlugin in class AuthorizationStack
      Parameters:
      plugin - the new instance of a plugin
      Returns:
      true if there is the class names are equal and the plugin is not null; false otherwise

    • getPlugin

      protected IAuthorizationPlugin getPlugin()
      Get the authorization plugin.
      Returns:
      the underlying plugin

    • isWorking

      public boolean isWorking()
      Check if the plugin exists and has not failed while loading.
      Overrides:
      isWorking in class AuthorizationEntity
      Returns:
      true if working, false otherwise

    • hasPlugin

      public boolean hasPlugin()
      Check if the plugin class was found for this plugin.
      Returns:
      true if was; false otherwise

    • clone

      public AuthorizationPlugin clone()

      • sets the plugin to null
      Overrides:

    • hierarchyToString

      public String hierarchyToString(String prefix, String colorElement)
      Print the plugin info.
      Overrides:
      hierarchyToString in class AuthorizationStack
      Parameters:
      prefix - this prefix should be prepended to every line produced by this stack
      colorElement - a possible element where any occurrence of %color% will be replaced with a HTML HEX color representing this entity state.
      Returns:
      the string containing this stack representation
